message_1: A sample of radioactive iodine-131 has an initial activity of 2000 Bq. Determine the activity of the sample after 8 days, given that the half-life of iodine-131 is 8 days.
message_2:
To determine the activity of the sample after 8 days, we can use the radioactive decay formula:

Activity_final = Activity_initial * (1/2)^(time_elapsed / half_life)

where
Activity_initial = 2000 Bq (initial activity)
time_elapsed = 8 days
half_life = 8 days (half-life of iodine-131)

Activity_final = 2000 * (1/2)^(8/8)
Activity_final = 2000 * (1/2)^1
Activity_final = 2000 * 0.5
Activity_final = 1000 Bq

The activity of the sample after 8 days is 1000 Bq.
